content: Cover art added. I had neglected to leave comment.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Good one.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: The conversion from decimal to roman numerals is complex enough to give most beginning programmers a challenge yet not so much that they would get discouraged. For more experienced programmers it is a satisfyingly quick  problem that builds confidence. Something to warm up on before tackling something more involved.

Nice that you include a link for standard roman numeral conversion and add the additional notes to avoid an incorrect assumption. I like this puzzle and think it is complex enough for medium but satisfyingly quicker than most.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Great job! It's possible some Codingamers might argue this is a hard "easy" puzzle as compared to a fairly easy "medium" puzzle. I like to see Title Case for test case names, but I've never seen that presented as a Codingame standard.  Still, please consider it.

I'd also like to see the title of your puzzle be in title case: Roman Sorting

Well done!

Input section
* Please add <<Line 1:>>.

* Please format "Next [[n]] lines:" in <<bold>>.

Thanks.

Thanks! Title Case applied to puzzle and test names.

I wavered on whether to submit it as Easy or Medium, but figured if a Medium player gets a puzzle that's a bit too easy, they'll knock out the answer quickly and move on to the next one; if a beginner gets a too-hard Easy puzzle, they might walk away from coding.
